title: AMP Capital fills St Georges Terrace tower as recovery gains ground
text:
AMP Capital has all but filled a Perth office tower at 140 St Georges Terrace after a run of leasing deals which will buoy hopes a recovery in the West Australian market is gaining traction.

The leasing streak has cut vacancy in the 29,929sq m tower to just 0.7 per cent, down from 30 per cent at the start of 2019.

Among those tenants signing up for space, Dampier Bunbury Natural Gas Pipeline with 2200sq m and AngloGold Ashanti with 2110sq m have committed to two whole floors each on long-term leases.

Almost filled: 140 St Georges Terrace, Perth.

Net face rents on some recent deals in the prominent tower were struck at $640 per square metre, while incentives on some deals have tightened from as much as 50 per cent to around 40 per cent, according to market sources.

Other tenants taking space in the St Georges Terrace tower include Downer Group, Viridian Advisory, and Talent International.
description: Vacancy in AMP Capital's 140 St Georges Terrace tower in Perth has fallen from 30 per cent at the start of the year to near zero.
